data.title: 48 Popular TikTok Songs You Need to Listen to in 2024
data.meta_description: Songs that are popular TikTok get popular in a lot of different ways. But they all have one thing in common: they're all definitely catchy. Here are 48 of the most popular TikTok songs.
data.text:
Ask Influencer Marketing Hub AI for quick summary

Key Trends in TikTok Music

Virality and Trends: Songs become popular on TikTok through challenges, memes, and creative uses in videos. Popular songs often accompany dance routines, lip-syncs, and various thematic content like makeup tutorials, cooking, and lifestyle videos.

Cross-Genre Popularity: TikTok's music trends encompass various genres, including pop, hip-hop, K-pop, reggaeton, and even nostalgic hits from previous decades.

Global Influence: Artists from around the world, including South Korean groups, British singers, and Latin artists, find their music trending on TikTok, highlighting the platform's global reach.

New Releases and Resurgences: Both new hits and older tracks experience renewed popularity on TikTok, driven by user creativity and engagement.

When you want to discover new music that will get you going, you wouldn’t think to go to TikTok, right? You’d normally explore curated playlists on Spotify or your favorite artist’s albums on Apple Music. But you can always find hidden gems in the places you wouldn’t normally think to look.

If you're wondering which songs have the world singing, dancing, and creating, we’ve compiled a list of 48 of the most popular songs taking over TikTok.

Let’s update your playlists with our list of the most popular songs on TikTok.

1. “If We Ever Broke Up” by Mae Stephens

@phoebe.mulyana if we ever broke up..? #dancechallenge #tiktokdance #newdance #tutorial ♬ If We Ever Broke Up - Mae Stephens

English singer-songwriter Mae Stephens’ 2023 hit has over 13 million views on her official YouTube channel. On TikTok, “If We Ever Broke Up” is the number one song globally on the platform’s Songs of the Summer 2023 list, with 13.9 million videos using the song. Big names like South Korean boy band ENHYPEN and girl groups ITZY and IVE have used the track, with videos showing hand gestures that represent a heartbreaking in two.

Mae Stephens' catchy hit "If We Ever Broke Up" has become a TikTok sensation with 13.9 million video creations.

2. “Makeba” by Jain

@2ins_kl♬ Makeba - Jain

Released in 2015, “Makeba” is enjoying a resurgence in popularity. On Jain’s YouTube channel, the song already has over 251 million views and has made it into TikTok’s Songs of the Summer list for top songs by video creations globally. As of writing, over 1 million video creations are using Jain’s hit song to feature food and other lifestyle content on the platform.

Jain's "Makeba," originally released in 2015, has seen a resurgence on TikTok, used in over 1 million videos for various content.

3. “What It Is – Solo Version” by Doechii

@czerone Whoever dances is handsome #hiphop #dance #foryoupage #fyp ♬ What It Is - Solo Version - Doechii

Doechii’s 2023 hit has over 43 million views on YouTube alone. On TikTok, nearly 2 million video creations that feature dances, clips, makeup tutorials, and more, are using the song as their background music. Due to its immense popularity on the platform, the song made it to TikTok’s Songs of the Summer 2023 list. This song contains explicit lyrics.

Doechii's "What It Is – Solo Version" has become immensely popular on TikTok, featured in nearly 2 million videos.

4. “Cupid – Twin Ver. – Sped Up Version” by FIFTY FIFTY

@we_fiftyfifty #FIFTYvod ??도 도전한 큐피드 손댄스 챌린지✌️✌️? #FIFTYFIFTY #TheBeginning #Cupid #피프티피프티 #큐피드 #KEENA #SIO #키나 #시오 #큐피드챌린지 #Cupidchallenge #큐피드손댄스 #Cupid손댄스 ♬ Cupid (Twin Ver.) - FIFTY FIFTY

FIFTY FIFTY’s original music video garnered over 149 million views on YouTube since it premiered in February 2023. The sped-up version is one of TikTok’s most popular songs, with 8.7 million video creations using it to showcase content ranging from food to memes. It’s also one of the top 10 songs globally on the platform’s Songs of the Summer 2023 list.

FIFTY FIFTY's "Cupid – Twin Ver. – Sped Up Version" has captivated TikTok users with 8.7 million video creations.

5. “LALA” by Myke Towers

@nicollefigueroaaLalala♬ LALA - Myke Towers

Myke Towers’ 2023 Spanish-language hit became viral on TikTok a few months ago. The song features a catchy, reggaeton beat with an LSS-inducing “Lala” vocal sample. It went on to top various charts, including the Billboard Global Excl. US chart. On TikTok “LALA” is used by 6.6 million video creations, ranging from dances and memes to bartending videos.

Myke Towers' "LALA" has topped charts and gone viral on TikTok with 6.6 million video creations.

6. “Houdini” by Dua Lipa

@kialozza ? @Dua Lipa #houdini #fypシ #fyp ♬ Houdini - Dua Lipa

Just a few days after its release, Dua Lipa’s latest song has already garnered over 20 million views on YouTube as of writing. “Houdini” boasts a percussion-heavy techno beat reminiscent of songs in the 70s and 80s with a catchy hook and chorus. The song is also one of Apple Music’s top picks for the biggest viral hits on TikTok in 2023. On TikTok, “Houdini” is used as a background for various dance clips featuring Dua Lipa or other content creators, lyric videos, and even memes.

Dua Lipa's "Houdini" quickly gained popularity, amassing over 20 million views on YouTube and becoming a TikTok favorite.

7. “Lovin On Me” by Jack Harlow

@austintaylorrrr Lovin on me ? this one goes craazy dc @Perri Kiely #duo #dance #nz ♬ Lovin On Me - Jack Harlow

“Lovin On Me” opens with a catchy vocal sample that’s reminiscent of 90s boyband hits. The song features great percussion complemented by Harlow’s flawless rap flow. Videos on TikTok use the song to showcase the sample’s similarity with other songs, dance challenges, and the “Vanilla Baby” trend.

Jack Harlow's "Lovin On Me" has become a TikTok hit, used in dance challenges and trending content.

8. “Strangers” by Kenya Grace

@eyasminbalit goes like this…♬ Strangers - Kenya Grace

Kenya Grace’s 2023 debut single “Strangers”, a drum and bass-laden single, catapulted the artist to the top of the charts, making her one of the only two British female artists (the other one is the legendary Kate Bush) to take the top spot on the Official Charts for a self-produced single. The song was initially successful in July 2023, when Grace released it on TikTok. She then released a follow-up video on the platform, which garnered over 38 million views.

Kenya Grace's debut single "Strangers" gained massive popularity on TikTok, contributing to her rapid rise in the music industry.

9. “Get him back!” by Olivia Rodrigo

@mafergaytann manifesting olivia tickets ? @Olivia Rodrigo #oliviarodrigo #livies #guts #gethimback #fyp ♬ get him back! - Olivia Rodrigo

The 8th track on her album Guts, "Get him back!" is a fun and relatable anthem featuring heartbreak and teen angst. It now has over 400,000 video creations, mainly featuring a duo dance challenge to the song’s bridge. You can also check out Olivia’s latest single, “Vampire”, which debuted at #1 on Billboard’s Hot 100 list. This song contains explicit lyrics.

Olivia Rodrigo's "Get him back!" is a relatable anthem that has inspired over 400,000 TikTok video creations.

10. “Super Shy” by NewJeans

@by.cmc super shy challenge with #Haerin ? #newjeans_haerin #newjeans #imsupershy #fyp ♬ Super Shy - NewJeans

Released in July 2023, the South Korean girl group’s hit has more than 110 million views on YouTube. On TikTok, the hashtag “newjeans_supershy” has 432.4 million views as of writing, with the song being used in 1.4 million video creations. The group also has another popular song called "ETA", which has been used in over 100,000 video creations to date.

NewJeans' "Super Shy" has garnered significant attention on TikTok, featured in 1.4 million video creations.

11. “City Boys” by Burna Boy

@clvudxvs dc; @jade @Iam.helo #cityboy #uk #explore ♬ City Boy - Burna Boy

The viral hit song “City Boys” is a hip-hop single with R&B and Afropop influences. This fan favorite comes from the artist’s seventh studio album “I Told Them…”, which became one of the top albums on charts like the Official U.K. Albums chart and Apple Music. Burna Boy’s viral hit is used in TikTok video creations to showcase dance challenges, lyrics, and even acrobatic stunts.

This song does contain explicit lyrics.

Burna Boy's "City Boys" has become a viral hit on TikTok, used in numerous dance challenges and creative videos.

12. “Water” by Tyla

@jntxlii Water - Tyla ? class/choreo: @Jm Yrreverre ♬ Water - Tyla

South African singer Tyla’s viral solo song “Water” was already trending on TikTok when it made a historic debut on the Billboard Hot 100 charts. The song features a mix of several genres, such as Afrobeats and Amapiano, which is a music subgenre that originated in South Africa. It inspired the “water dance challenge” created by choreographer Litchi and is even used in videos by women wanting to “test” (the Tyla “Water” test) if their partners have wandering eyes.

Tyla's "Water" inspired the viral "water dance challenge" and has been a hit on TikTok, featured in countless videos.

13. “What Was I Made For?” by Billie Eilish

@sophiaaljufrigpp yg penting candid beneran♬ What Was I Made For? [From The Motion Picture "Barbie"] - Billie Eilish

Part of the Barbie soundtrack, Billie Eilish’s sentimental ballad has been used in over 1.7 million video creations on TikTok. The song's personal lyrics and soft melody strike a chord with listeners. Its official music video, which was directed by Eilish herself, has nearly 70 million views on YouTube.

Billie Eilish's "What Was I Made For?" from the Barbie soundtrack has resonated with TikTok users, leading to over 1.7 million video creations.

14. “Vampire” by Olivia Rodrigo

@aespa_official ?‍♀️?? #vampire #OliviaRodrigo #aespa #æspa #에스파 #GISELLE #지젤 #KARINA #카리나 ♬ vampire - Olivia Rodrigo

“Vampire” opens with a sentimental piano accompaniment and builds up into a powerful percussion-laden piece that showcases Rodrigo’s vocal range. The song, whose video premiered on YouTube in June 2023 and has garnered over 72 million views, is part of Rodrigo’s sophomore album “Guts” and is used on TikTok as a background for lyric videos, clips of Olivia Rodrigo singing, and creators singing along to the song.

This song does contain explicit lyrics.

Olivia Rodrigo's "Vampire" has become a TikTok favorite, used in various creative and lip-sync videos.

15. “Endless Summer” by Alan Walker and Zak Abel

@hara08_wotagei #endlesssummer でヲタ芸してみた！ #alanwalker #zak_abel ♬ オリジナル楽曲 - はら 【ヲタ芸】

“Endless Summer” has an uplifting beat that features dance-pop influences. The drop and chorus, complemented by a bassline and percussion, are catchy, blissful segments that make listeners want to dance and enjoy the freedom that summer brings. On TikToK, “Endless Summer” is used as a background for videos showcasing concerts, parties, and duets.

This song does contain explicit lyrics.

"Endless Summer" by Alan Walker and Zak Abel is a feel-good track that's popular on TikTok for concert and party videos.

16. “Paint The Town Red” by Doja Cat

@czerone Dance with your friends #hiphop #paintthetownred #inmyfeelings #fy ♬ Paint The Town Red - Doja Cat

Released in August 2023, Doja Cat’s “Paint The Town Red” has become a big hit on TikTok, with an estimated 2.6 million video creations, featuring different dances, makeup tutorials, and people just lipsyncing. Its official video, which was co-directed by Doja Cat herself, has over 100 million views on YouTube.

The song does contain explicit lyrics.

Doja Cat's "Paint The Town Red" has become a TikTok sensation, used in over 2.6 million videos.

17. “greedy” by Tate McRae

@sabrinabahsoon Brb this is on repeat. #greedy @tate mcrae #tubegirl #tubegirleffect ♬ greedy - Tate McRae

The song’s pop hook is one of the things that makes it an earworm. It’s complemented by playful dance beats that make listeners want to sing or dance along to the song. Its video, which premiered on YouTube in September 2023, showcases McRae’s powerful dance moves, featuring choreography by Sean Bankhead.

The song does contain explicit lyrics.

Tate McRae's "greedy" has captivated TikTok users with its catchy hook and dance-worthy beats.

18. “Everyday” by Ariana Grande ft. Future

@ninisha2002 Lalalala~??#everyday #arianagrande #dancechallenge #fypシ゚viral ♬ Everyday - Ariana Grande

While this song was released in 2017, it has enjoyed a resurgence in popularity thanks to TikTok. In fact, “Everyday” was part of the platform’s list of Global Songs of the Summer 2023. On the platform, Grande’s song is used as a background for dance clips, lyrics videos, and dance tutorials.

The song does contain explicit lyrics.

Ariana Grande's "Everyday" has enjoyed renewed popularity on TikTok, featured in numerous dance and lyric videos.

19. “Sprinter” by Central Cee and Dave

@davidvooo? (dc me)♬ Sprinter - Dave & Central Cee

The music video for this 2023 hit has already garnered over 146 million views on YouTube and has become one of TikTok's top songs in the UK for Summer 2023. The collaborative hip-hop track showcases the rap skills of Central Cee and Dave, propelling it to the top of various charts, including the Official U.K. Singles Chart.

This song contains explicit lyrics.

Central Cee and Dave's "Sprinter" has become a top song on TikTok in the UK, with over 146 million views on YouTube.

20. “Pretty (Sped Up)” by MEYY

@lindamont #breakfast #grwm #nike #nikewomenmx #nikewomen ♬ Pretty (Sped Up) - MEYY

The sped-up version of Belgian singer MEYY’s song has become one of TikTok’s top songs in the UK for Summer 2023. On the platform, the song is used in videos featuring makeup tutorials, arts and crafts, and fit checks.

The lyrics, which are in French interspersed with English verses, were taken from a poem that MEYY wrote.

MEYY's "Pretty (Sped Up)" is a TikTok hit in the UK, used in makeup tutorials and creative videos.

21. “Little Girl Gone” by CHINCHILLA

@miuka.povs #pov (FL⚠️) The new recruits talk sh*t about the mafia boss not knowing she’s right behind them… #foryoupage ♬ Little Girl Gone - CHINCHILLA

CHINCHILLA’s 2023 hit is an angsty pop-rock anthem that became viral on TikTok and has become a powerful anthem for people who are experiencing or have experienced abuse. The song, which has garnered over 10 million streams, has also contributed to the British singer-songwriter’s growing popularity on TikTok, where she now has hundreds of thousands of followers. The preview of the song was so well-received on TikTok that when she posted the video, it accumulated a million views in less than 24 hours.

The song contains explicit lyrics.

CHINCHILLA's "Little Girl Gone" has become a powerful anthem on TikTok, used in videos addressing personal struggles and abuse.

22. “It’s a Wrap (Sped Up)” by Mariah Carey

@joealbaneseITS A WRAAAAAP♬ It's A Wrap - Sped Up - Mariah Carey

“It’s a Wrap” was originally recorded and released in 2009 but the song has since seen a revival, thanks in part to the viral “It’s a Wrap” challenge. Lambs, a term used to refer to Mariah’s fans, were lip-synching to the song and gave it a significant bump on streaming platforms. The sped-up version is part of Mariah Carey’s special release, which also includes a new edit of the song and a remix assisted by the equally legendary Mary J. Blige.

Mariah Carey's "It’s a Wrap" challenge has revived her 2009 song, making it a TikTok favorite.

23. “Seven (feat. Latto) – Clean Ver.” By Jungkook

@cocona.dance Seven #jungkook #seven #dance #cover #fyp #05 #정국 @JK ♬ Seven (feat. Latto) - Clean Ver. - Jung Kook & Latto

BTS' Jungkook's debut solo single "Seven" has taken the internet by storm, accumulating 260 million views on YouTube and ranking among the Top 100 Music Videos (global) at #55. But the craze doesn't stop there. On TikTok, the song has become a viral sensation, inspiring 1.6 million video creations of people showcasing their dance moves and choreography to the infectious beat. Even big names like Dasuri Choi and BTS themselves have joined in on the fun, adding to the song's growing popularity.

BTS' Jungkook's debut solo single "Seven" has taken TikTok by storm with 1.6 million video creations.

24. “Never Felt So Alone” by Labrinth

@lyzzahh♬ Never Felt So Alone - Labrinth

“Never Felt So Alone” is a dreamy piece accompanied by light percussions and sorrowful beats and features backing vocals by Billie Eilish. A song that talks about loneliness, it was featured in the HBO drama Euphoria and was one of TikTok’s top Songs of the Summer in the UK for 2023. On the platform, “Never Felt So Alone” is used by creators to feature song covers, memes, and clips featuring Labrinth and Eilish.

This song contains potentially triggering lyrics.

Labrinth's "Never Felt So Alone," featuring Billie Eilish, has become a TikTok hit, used in emotional and creative videos.

25. “Lil Boo Thang” by Paul Russell

@retiredprofessionals Its a bop! ✨ DC: our own @Anniese ##boothang #momsover40 #dancingmoms #orlandomoms #retiredprofessionals #momswhodance #momsoftiktok ♬ Lil Boo Thang - Paul Russell

This upbeat, catchy viral hit features a sample of The Emotions’ “Best of My Love” and became the song of the summer when a short clip was released in June on TikTok. On the platform, the song quickly amassed millions of views and has been repurposed to showcase couple dances, fit check videos, and yes, memes. “Lil Boo Thang” opens up with funk, R&B, and rap influences and evokes optimism. Since becoming viral on TikTok, Russell released the single on August 2023 and made a lot of waves on several charts, including the Billboard Hot 100.

Paul Russell's "Lil Boo Thang" has become a viral hit on TikTok, used in millions of videos.

26. “girls like me don’t cry (sped up)” by thuy

@fabetwinzgirls like us dont cry?♬ girls like me don't cry (sped up) - thuy

Originally released in 2022, thuy’s hit song has since garnered over 20 million views. The sped-up version became so popular on TikTok that it has 9.8 million videos on the platform. Videos range from cleaning-related content and makeup tutorials to cooking shorts and unboxing videos. The sped-up version also made it to TikTok’s Songs of the Summer 2023 and is ranked #3 globally.

Thuy's "girls like me don’t cry (sped up)" is a TikTok sensation with 9.8 million video creations.

27. “Daylight” by David Kushner

@leah_z1 surreal @david kushner ♬ Daylight - David Kushner

“Daylight” made it to LoudKult’s Spotify list of the biggest songs on TikTok for 2023. The official music video has garnered over 147 million views on YouTube since it premiered in April 2023. The song, which drew comparisons to Irish singer-songwriter Hozier’s songs, features Kushner’s soulful and deep vocals complemented by a melancholic piano accompaniment. "Daylight" began to gain popularity on TikTok when Kushner started teasing about the single on the platform. Fan recordings, including a particular video with 30 million views, of Kushner performing the song also contributed to its viral success.

David Kushner's "Daylight" has gained popularity on TikTok, featured in fan recordings and creative content.

28. “Say Yes to Heaven” by Lana Del Rey

@kyliejenner♬ Say Yes To Heaven - Sped Up - Lana Del Rey

Lana Del Rey’s dreamy and soulful “Say Yes to Heaven” was a previously unreleased track written in 2012 and recorded in 2013. Its sped-up version went viral on TikTok in 2022, which potentially played a major role in encouraging the release of the official studio version in 2023. The song, particularly its pre-chorus and chorus, has since been used by over a million users in more than 800,000 posts.

Lana Del Rey's "Say Yes to Heaven" became viral on TikTok, leading to its official release in 2023.

29. “Dance The Night” by Dua Lipa

@brookieandjessiewhos excited for the Barbie movie ?? WE ARE XX♬ Dance The Night (From Barbie The Album) - Dua Lipa

An iconic song from the Barbie movie, this disco-pop number has been used in over 487,000 videos on TikTok, featuring people dancing to the song, dance tutorials, and clips from the movie. Its official music video, which premiered in May 2023, has garnered nearly 119 million views to date, captivating audiences with its visuals and choreography. Once you listen to it, this bop is guaranteed to get you in the mood to groove.

Dua Lipa's "Dance The Night" from the Barbie movie has become a popular TikTok song, used in dance and movie clips.

30. “People” by Libianca

@chikakikuga hafal♬ People - Libianca

Featuring Libianca’s soulful vocals, this dreamy pop song has Afrobeat influences and talks about the singer’s experience with cyclothymia, a rare mood disorder that causes people to experience periods of emotional ups and downs. “People” has since become a chart-topper, rising to number one on the UK Afrobeats chart in March 2023. On TikTok, creators use “People” for videos showcasing the song’s lyrics, dance tutorials, and covers.

This song contains potentially triggering lyrics.

Libianca's "People" has captivated TikTok users with its soulful vocals and Afrobeat influences.

31. “Barbie Girl” by Aqua

@vivy.th พาบาร์บี้มาเดินช้อปปิ้ง #barbie #barbiegirl #barbiethailand ♬ Barbie Girl - Aqua

90s kids will surely remember this hit from the Europop band Aqua. Originally released in 1997, “Barbie Girl” has enjoyed a resurgence in popularity thanks to the Barbie movie. On TikTok, the song has been used in 6.3 million video creations by content creators like Trisha Paytas, Dylan Mulvaney, and more. The song also made it to TikTok’s Songs of the Summer 2023, coming in at #9.

Aqua's 90s hit "Barbie Girl" has enjoyed a resurgence on TikTok, used in millions of videos.

32. “Barbie World (with Aqua)” by Nicki Minaj and Ice Spice

@mo0dzz Barbie world baybeeee ??? #fyp #fypシ #nickiminaj #nicki #icespice #barbie #barbiegirl #barbieworld @Nicki Minaj @ice spice ♬ Barbie World (with Aqua) [From Barbie The Album] - Nicki Minaj & Ice Spice & Aqua

Putting a new spin on the beloved classic, Nicki Minaj and Ice Spice’s “Barbie World” is mainly a rap track. The official music video already has over 107 million views on YouTube, while on TikTok, the song has been used in 1.6 million video creations to serve as background music for art clips, fashion videos, and even memes. The song also made it to TikTok’s list of the top 10 songs in the UK for Summer 2023. The song contains explicit lyrics.

Nicki Minaj and Ice Spice's "Barbie World" has become a TikTok hit, used in 1.6 million video creations.

33. “Unholy” by Sam Smith featuring Kim Petras

@brunaargolo_o ?#1million #dance #unholy ♬ Unholy - Sam Smith & Kim Petras

Released over a year ago, “Unholy” still gets a lot of traction on TikTok and YouTube, where the official music video has gained over 217 million views since its 2022 premiere. The song showcases influences of various music subgenres including electropop and synth-pop. On TikTok, the song gave rise to the “Unholy” TikTok trend, with videos typically featuring seductive dance choreographies, while others show creators acting out the song’s lyrics. A TikTok video, which used a part of “Unholy”, posted on Smith’s account garnered approximately 38 million views and over 4 million likes.

The song contains explicit and potentially triggering lyrics.

Sam Smith and Kim Petras' "Unholy" continues to be popular on TikTok, inspiring seductive dance trends.

34. “Lose Control” by Teddy Swims

@tiptoptoks I am just a small girl in a big world trying to find someone to love ?? (@Harperzilmer) #teddyswims #losecontrol #love #relationship #christmas #cuffingseason #marylinmonroe ♬ Lose Control - Teddy Swims

The live video version of “Lose Control” premiered in June 2023 on YouTube. Since then, the video featuring Teddy Swims with a live band has garnered over 22 million views. The viral song has R&B and pop influences and highlights Teddy Swims’ raspy, soulful vocals and impressive vocal range. It made it to Apple Music’s list of the top TikTok Songs for 2023 and peaked at number 67 on the Hot 100 charts.

The song contains potentially triggering lyrics.

Teddy Swims' "Lose Control" has become a viral hit on TikTok, showcasing his soulful vocals.

35. “There It Goes” by Maisie Peters

@sally_reputation i made it to September #thereitgoesmaisiepeters #september #healing @maisie peters ♬ There It Goes - Maisie Peters

Singer-songwriter Maisie Peters’ upbeat and catchy pop hit showcases her dreamy vocals and makes listeners want to dance along to this fresh tune. On Spotify, “There It Goes”, with its LSS-inducing bridge, has amassed over 6.5 million streams as of writing.

Maisie Peters' "There It Goes" is an upbeat pop hit that has gained popularity on TikTok.

36. “Good Love” by 220 KID

@dance_0170 #ROSE? #ARTGIRLS #ChineseJAZZ #JazzGirl #SoEasy #ForYou ♬ Good Love - 220 KID

220 KID’s electropop tune has been used in over 50,000 posts on TikTok featuring videos ranging from transformations to artworks. One video that used “Good Love” and showcased the “then and now” trend has garnered over 350,000 views. The song also made it to Apple Music’s list of the top TikTok Songs for 2023.

220 KID's "Good Love" has been used in over 50,000 TikTok posts, featuring various creative content.

37. “Boy’s a Liar Pt.2” by PinkPantheress and Ice Spice

@tiptoptoks BOYS A LIIAAARRRR (@Retirement House) #icespice #pinkpantheress #boysaliar #fyp ♬ Boy's a liar Pt. 2 - PinkPantheress & Ice Spice

A sequel to PinkPantheress's song Boy's a Liar, this hit is about a girl who suspects her boyfriend of cheating on her. Despite its melancholic theme, the song’s catchy electropop sound makes it a bop. The song has already been used in 2 million video creations on TikTok. The official music video has garnered over 165 million views on YouTube.

"Boy’s a Liar Pt.2" by PinkPantheress and Ice Spice has become a TikTok sensation with 2 million video creations.

38. “Mr. Take Ya B***h” by Lil Mabu featuring ChriseanRock

@sixonesix616 MR. TAKE YA B ?? @mabu? @chriseanrockbaby #dance #foryou #trend ♬ MR. TAKE YA B*TCH (FEAT. CHRISEANROCK) - Lil Mabu & CHRISEAN ROCK

This song is one of Tokchart’s trending songs for November 2023. It’s been used in over 1.2 million videos on TikTok and the official music video, which premiered on YouTube in October 2023, has already amassed over 22 million views. As of writing, in the last 24 hours alone, more than 22,000 new TikTok videos have used this song.

This song contains explicit lyrics.

Lil Mabu's "Mr. Take Ya B**h" has become a trending song on TikTok, used in over 1.2 million videos.

39. “Lollipop” by Darell

@evleal_Quieen dice que no me lo seee?♬ Lollipop - Darell

The bachata-influenced song by Puerto Rican artist Darell has become viral on TikTok and reached Spotify’s global Top 20 list on October 2023. The song has been featured in approximately 1.44 million TikTok videos, and according to Tokchart, over the last 24 hours, more than 35,000 videos have used "Lollipop".

This song contains explicit lyrics.

Darell's bachata-influenced "Lollipop" has become viral on TikTok, featured in 1.44 million videos.

40. “Cruel Summer” by Taylor Swift

@marshastardustIt was, a cruel summer♬ Cruel Summer - Taylor Swift

First released in 2019 as part of Taylor Swift's Lover album, "Cruel Summer" has enjoyed a resurgence thanks to Taylor's Eras Tour. Its powerful lyrics, particularly its bridge, have captured the hearts of Swifties worldwide. The official audio video on YouTube has amassed over 123 million views, while on Spotify, the song has been streamed over 1.2 billion times. Additionally, "Cruel Summer" has gone viral on TikTok, with over 2.3 million posts featuring the song. These videos range from cooking demos and concert clips to people having fun and lip-syncing to the song.

Frequently Asked Questions

What are the most popular songs on TikTok?

In this post, we have case studies of the most popular songs on TikTok at the time of writing. These will, of course, change over time. These currently are:

“If We Ever Broke Up” by Mae Stephens

“Makeba” by Jain

“What It Is – Solo Version” by Doechii

“Cupid – Twin Ver. – Sped Up Version” by FIFTY FIFTY

“Super Shy” by NewJeans

Does TikTok make songs popular?

Technically, success on TikTok won’t help make music popular again - Billboard doesn’t track TikTok or include it in its calculations. Billboard does consider streaming, but it takes a lot of listens to equate to an album sale. The problem with music on TikTok is that fame can be fickle – today’s trend quickly becomes yesterday’s has-been. Yet, the songs we’ve covered here have become popular again on TikTok – at least for a short time within the TikTok platform.

How do I get 1-minute songs on TikTok?

Most songs on TikTok are 15 seconds, despite being able to upload videos of 60 seconds on the platform. This is because TikTok has a special license with music providers that only permits them to play a 15-second clip. However, you can get around this if you upload MP3 files from your phone to act as soundtracks to your 60-second videos. Be aware that TikTok sometimes cracks down on the use of non-copyright music in videos and may remove your track.

How do you find trending songs on TikTok?

It is surprisingly tricky to find trending songs on TikTok. One way is to go into your Discover section, click on a few videos, and note the music used in these videos. Another method is to click + on your home screen and then tap Sounds. This will bring up a series of song suggestions, including a category for TikTok Viral. Alternatively, you could click on one of the other playlists that TikTok recommends.

How do you put songs on TikTok?

Although most people use the songs already in TikTok’s library, nothing stops you from adding songs yourself. Begin by recording your video and saving it. Ensure you have uploaded the music you want as an MP3. Tap the + button in TikTok. Select Upload and select the video you previously recorded. Tap Mute to silence the original video. Tap Back. Then select the audio option you want and choose your intended soundtrack. Tap the 3-dot menu, then +. Adjust the resulting audio wave appropriately.

How do songs go viral on TikTok?

As we have seen in this article, various songs have become incredibly popular as video backdrops on TikTok. And this often happens without any action by or even knowledge of the artist who released the song. Of course, if you actively want your songs to go viral on TikTok, you can help the process. Share short videos yourself, featuring your tracks. Create content that appeals to Generation Z. Use suitable hashtags. Use Spotlight if you’re in an eligible country.
